paragraphs.name: 682b
paragraphs.text: The same was true for the Product Marketing group. I hired a Director of Product Marketing who in his last company had ran its marketing and then went out into the field and became its national sales director. He got the job when I asked him how much of his own marketing material his sales team actually used in the field. When he said, “about ten percent,” I knew by the embarrassed look on his face I had found the right guy. And our Director of Technical Marketing was superb at understanding customer needs and communicating them to Engineering.

paragraphs.name: d945
paragraphs.text: If these sound like reasonable answers to you, and you are in a startup, update your resume.
If these sound like reasonable answers to you, and you are in a startup, update your resume.
paragraphs.name: d945

paragraphs.text: And it was going to mention the two words that marketing needed to live and breathe: revenue and profit.

This year, marketing needs to provide sales with 40,000 active and accepted leads, company and product name recognition over 65% in our target market, and five positive product reviews per quarter. We will reach 35% market share in year one of sales with a headcount of twenty people, spending less than $4,000,000.
It wasn’t that I had somehow inherited dumb employees. What I was hearing was a failure of management.

fe25de35fb9d.title: I agree with driving accountability through a “No Excuses” culture.

paragraphs.text: I agree with driving accountability through a “No Excuses” culture. But many times that statement can be heard as “If you make a mistake, you’ll lose your job” and then you have an organization paralyzed by fear. Asking your team to take risks has to come with the assurance that leaders are ok with some kinds and some amount of failure.

paragraphs.name: 74b1
paragraphs.text: While the problem you show is common, the mission you wrote is not a good one. Your mission statement should only talk about the high level objective.

paragraphs.text: Your targets should be in your yearly goals.

paragraphs.name: c9e3
paragraphs.text: The how should be in your plan. And you should encourage people to meet the goals with different plans.

d20452976e1.title: “No Excuse” culture is an awesome takeaway.

paragraphs.text: “No Excuse” culture is an awesome takeaway. I should admit that I should strongly go by this. Additionally, investing in your employees and renting a serviced office from a good community will provide you that extra vibe. I work out of Evoma serviced office, Bangalore, India, https://evoma.com/get-an-office/ and love the positivity and knowledge sharing going on.

fbda59bf5b5e.title: This should come from the very top of organization.

paragraphs.name: e4e0
paragraphs.text: This should come from the very top of organization. First, you establish the mission of your company as a whole, then you establish the mission of your department that is aligned with the first one. Then, you plan every activity in alignment with this mission and everything becomes super simple. Of course, it requires awfully huge amount of internal selling ;)

560fd52b7bfb.title: Thank you for taking the time to publish this.

paragraphs.name: f904
paragraphs.text: Thank you for taking the time to publish this. It helped me to think about my mission and goals and to surround myself with others of like mind. Open to new ideas and enthusiasm to improve, not count the hours and limit 1/3 of your life to a choir without any real direction and want.
